summary: Use this api to search orders
description: Use this api to search orders. You may also filter them by status, if needed.

query.name: time_range_field
query.description: The kind of time_from and time_to. Available value: create_time, update_time.

query.name: time_from
query.description: The time_from and time_to fields specify a date range for retrieving orders (based on the time_range_field). The time_from field is the starting date range. The maximum date range that may be specified with the time_from and time_to fields is 15 days.

query.name: time_to
query.description: The time_from and time_to fields specify a date range for retrieving orders (based on the time_range_field). The time_from field is the starting date range. The maximum date range that may be specified with the time_from and time_to fields is 15 days.

query.name: page_size
query.description: Each result set is returned as a page of entries. Use the "page_size" filters to control the maximum number of entries to retrieve per page (i.e., per call). This integer value is used to specify the maximum number of entries to return in a single "page" of data.The limit of page_size if between 1 and 100.

query.name: cursor
query.description: Specifies the starting entry of data to return in the current call. The default is empty. If the data is more than one page, the offset can be some entry to start the next call.

query.name: order_status
query.description: The order_status filter for retriveing orders and each one only every request. Available value: UNPAID/READY_TO_SHIP/PROCESSED/SHIPPED/COMPLETED/IN_CANCEL/CANCELLED/INVOICE_PENDING

query.name: response_optional_fields
query.description: Optional fields in response. Available value: order_status.

query.name: request_order_status_pending
query.description: Compatible parameter during migration period, send True will let API support PENDING status, send False or donâ€™t send will fallback to old logic.

query.name: logistics_channel_id
query.description: The identity of logistic channel. Valid only for BR.

request_examples.code:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, array(
  CURLOPT_URL => 'https://partner.shopeemobile.com/api/v2/order/get_order_list?access_token=access_token&cursor=%22%22&order_status=READY_TO_SHIP&page_size=20&partner_id=partner_id&response_optional_fields=order_status&shop_id=shop_id&sign=sign&time_from=1607235072&time_range_field=create_time&time_to=1608271872&timestamp=timestamp',
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => '',
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 0,
  CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => 'GET',
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array(
    'Content-Type: application/json'
  ),
));

$response = curl_exec($curl);

curl_close($curl);
echo $response;

schema.name: request_id
schema.description: The identifier for an API request for error tracking.

schema.name: error
schema.description: Indicate error type if hit error. Empty if no error happened.

schema.name: message
schema.description: Indicate error details if hit error. Empty if no error happened.

schema.name: more
schema.description: This is to indicate whether the order list is more than one page. If this value is true, you may want to continue to check next page to retrieve orders.

schema.name: order_sn
schema.description: Shopee's unique identifier for an order.

schema.name: order_status
schema.description: The order_status filter for retriveing orders and each one only every request. Available value: UNPAID/READY_TO_SHIP/PROCESSED/SHIPPED/COMPLETED/IN_CANCEL/CANCELLED

schema.name: booking_sn
schema.description: Return by default. Shopee's unique identifier for a booking. Only returned for advance fulfilment matched order only.

schema.name: next_cursor
schema.description: If more is true, you should pass the next_cursor in the next request as cursor. The value of next_cursor will be empty string when more is false.

error_codes.message: Sorry you don't have the permission, detail: {msg}.
System error. Please try again later.
Start time must be earlier than end time and diff in 15days.
There is no access_token in query.
There is no partner_id in query.
There is no sign in query.
